revised_title: Experimental Research on the Pharmacological Action of the Venom of Bungarus Coeruleus (Common Krait)
tldr: This study investigates the pharmacological effects of the venom of the common krait (Bungarus coeruleus) on frogs, rats, and rabbits. The research focuses on determining the minimum lethal dose, protective power of Calmette's serum, and the impact on nerve endings. The findings indicate that krait venom has a higher lethal action on rabbits compared to rats and that Calmette's antivenomous serum is ineffective against krait venom.
